segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena raññā pasenadinā kosalena mahājanakāyo bandhāpito hoti, appekacce rajjūhi appekacce andūhi appekacce saṅkhalikāhi.
segments.en: Now at that time a large group of people had been put in shackles by King Pasenadi of Kosala—some in ropes, some in manacles, some in chains.

segments.pli: Atha kho sambahulā bhikkhū pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya sāvatthiṃ piṇḍāya pavisiṃsu.
segments.en: Then several mendicants robed up in the morning and, taking their bowls and robes, entered Sāvatthī for alms.

segments.pli: Sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu. Ekamantaṃ nisinnā kho te bhikkhū bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ:
segments.en: Then, after the meal, when they returned from alms-round, they went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what was happening.

segments.pli: “idha, bhante, raññā pasenadinā kosalena mahājanakāyo bandhāpito, appekacce rajjūhi appekacce andūhi appekacce saṅkhalikāhī”ti.
Atha kho bhagavā etamatthaṃ viditvā tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imā gāthāyo abhāsi:
segments.en: Then, knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha recited these verses:
“The wise say that shackle is not strong
that’s made of iron, wood, or knots.
But obsession with jewels and earrings,
concern for your partners and children:
this the wise say is a strong shackle
that drags you down, tight, hard to escape.
They cut this too and go forth,
unconcerned, having given up sensual pleasures.”

sections.title: Now at that time a large group of people…

suttaplex.blurb: When many people are put in chains by Pasenadi, the matter is reported to the Buddha.
